title: Are two successive discounts of 10% and 20% equivalent to a single discount of? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let the cost of the article = 100 While selling the article 10% discount is given So S P = 100 — (10/100)*100 = 100— 10 = 90 Again on this price 20% discount is given So S P = 90 — (20/100)*90 =90 — 18 = 72 Single discount = 10 + 18 = 28% of cost of the article (It is not simple addition of 10%+20% = 30% )
A 100 unit piece is sold at 90 after 10 percent then additional 20persent i.e. 18 is deducted i.e. 28 deducted .. means you got 28pwrcent discount
